data.title: Yoda translation
data.statement: Given a backward quote from Yoda, rewrite it in an understandable way.

testCases.title: Test 3
testCases.testIn:
3
Much to learn you still have
testCases.testOut: You still have much to learn

3

testCases.testOut: Master Obi-wan has lost a planet

5

testCases.testOut: Do you judge me by the size

testCases.title: Test 6

testCases.testOut: May the Force be with you

data.constraints:
0  ≤ [[n]] ≤ number of words in [[yoda]]
0 < length of [[yoda]] ≤ 256

There is <<no ponctuation>> in the sentences. A quote from Yoda will not start with a name <<but may contain>>.
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
read yoda:string(255)
write sentence
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>>  The number [[n]] of words to be put at the end of  the sentence.
<<Line 2:>> A string [[yoda]] corresponding to the sentence from Yoda.
data.outputDescription:
A string [[sentence]] with words in expected order.
Note that the output is <<case sensitive>>.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given a backward quote from Yoda, rewrite it in an understandable way.
Input
Line 1: The number n of words to be put at the end of the sentence.
Line 2: A string yoda corresponding to the sentence from Yoda.
Output
A string sentence with words in expected order.
Note that the output is case sensitive.
Constraints
0 ≤ n ≤ number of words in yoda
0 < length of yoda ≤ 256

There is no ponctuation in the sentences. A quote from Yoda will not start with a name but may contain.
Example
Input
1
Patience you must have
Output
You must have patience
